original_solution_mapping.L1: If Flying Scotsman had 20 more carriages than Norwich, and Norwich had 100 carriages, then Flying Scotsman had 100 + 20 = <<20+100=120>>120 carriages.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Together, Flying Scotsman and Norwich had 120 +100 = <<120+100=220>>220 carriages.
original_solution_mapping.L3: If Euston had 130 carriages, 20 more carriages than Norfolk, Norfolk had 130 - 20 = <<130-20=110>>110 carriages.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Together, Euston and Norfolk had 110 + 130 = <<110+130=240>>240 carriages.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Altogether, Euston, Norfolk, Norwich, and Flying Scotsman had 240 + 220 = <<240+220=460>>460 carriages.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 5362.
    Returns: the total number of carriages in all towns.
    """
    # L1
    norwich_carriages = 100 # Norwich had 100 carriages
    flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich = 20 # 20 more carriages than Norwich
    flying_scotsman_carriages = norwich_carriages + flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich

    # L2
    flying_scotsman_norwich_total = flying_scotsman_carriages + norwich_carriages

    # L3
    euston_carriages = 130 # Euston had 130 carriages
    euston_more_than_norfolk = 20 # 20 more carriages than Norfolk
    norfolk_carriages = euston_carriages - euston_more_than_norfolk

    # L4
    euston_norfolk_total = norfolk_carriages + euston_carriages

    # L5
    total_carriages = euston_norfolk_total + flying_scotsman_norwich_total

    # FA
    answer = total_carriages
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If Flying Scotsman had {flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich} more carriages than Norwich, and Norwich had {norwich_carriages} carriages, then Flying Scotsman had {norwich_carriages} + {flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich} = <<{flying_scotsman_more_than_norwich}+{norwich_carriages}={flying_scotsman_carriages}>>{flying_scotsman_carriages} carriages.

Together, Flying Scotsman and Norwich had {flying_scotsman_carriages} +{norwich_carriages} = <<{flying_scotsman_carriages}+{norwich_carriages}={flying_scotsman_norwich_total}>>{flying_scotsman_norwich_total} carriages.

If Euston had {euston_carriages} carriages, {euston_more_than_norfolk} more carriages than Norfolk, Norfolk had {euston_carriages} - {euston_more_than_norfolk} = <<{euston_carriages}-{euston_more_than_norfolk}={norfolk_carriages}>>{norfolk_carriages} carriages.
Together, Euston and Norfolk had {norfolk_carriages} + {euston_carriages} = <<{norfolk_carriages}+{euston_carriages}={euston_norfolk_total}>>{euston_norfolk_total} carriages.

Altogether, Euston, Norfolk, Norwich, and Flying Scotsman had {euston_norfolk_total} + {flying_scotsman_norwich_total} = <<{euston_norfolk_total}+{flying_scotsman_norwich_total}={total_carriages}>>{total_carriages} carriages.
